src:
BNPB dan ITB Rancang Kampus Tangguh Bencana
02 Nov 2019, 17:01 by Anwar Siswadi (Kontributor), Erwin Prima
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Bencana (BNPB) dan Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB) merancang program Kampus Tangguh Bencana.
Kepala BNPB Doni Monardo mengatakan rancangan itu meliputi sistem, organisasi, dan manajemen yang siap menghadapi ancaman bencana sesuai potensi yang ada. “SOP (standard operating procedure) akan dibahas bersama,” katanya di Gedung Rektorat ITB, Bandung, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Rektor ITB Kadarsah Suryadi mengatakan model Kampus Tangguh Bencana ditargetkan rampung tahun depan atau 2020. “Kalau beres bisa diduplikasi kampus atau sekolah lain,” katanya.
Perancangannya akan melibatkan lintas disiplin ilmu di ITB yang punya 110 kelompok keahlian. ITB nantinya akan membuat lembaga khusus untuk menangani ketangguhan bencana. Kampus ITB tersebar di Bandung, Jatinangor-Sumedang, dan Cirebon.
Selain itu BNPB mengajak ITB melakukan riset dan kerja sama dengan sejumlah lembaga dari luar negeri. “Jika terjadi bencana maka tim dari ITB bersama tim reaksi cepat dari BNPB berada di lapangan untuk melakukan kajian penelitian,” kata Doni. Tujuannya untuk mendapatkan gambaran utuh soal bencana yang terjadi.
Doni mencontohkan peristiwa gempa di Maluku. “Sejak 26 September lalu sampai hari ini gempa susulannya hampir mencapai 2.000 kali,” katanya.
Ratusan gempa itu di antaranya dirasakan warga. BNPB menunjang risetnya dengan memasang seismograf di 11 titik seperti di Pulau Ambon, Haruku, dan Saparua. “Sehingga dapat gambaran yang utuh dari gempa yang sangat agresif di Maluku.”
Deputi Bidang Sistem dan Strategi BNPB Wisnu Widjaja mengatakan program Kampus Tangguh Bencana belum pernah dibicarakan dengan menteri terkait. Sebelum dengan ITB, konsep serupa telah dibuat Universitas Gadjah Mada dan sebuah kampus swasta di Bali. “Rencananya akan dibahas dalam pertemuan dengan Mendikbud,” katanya.
ANWAR SISWADI
text:
BNPB and ITB Design Disaster Resilient Campus
02 Nov 2019, 17:01 by Anwar Siswadi (Contributor), Erwin Prima
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - The National Disaster Management Agency (BNPB) and the Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB) designed the Resilient Disaster Campus program.
BNPB Head Doni Monardo said the draft includes systems, organizations and management that are ready to face the threat of disaster according to the existing potential. "SOP (standard operating procedure) will be discussed together," he said at the ITB Rectorate Building, Bandung, Friday, November 1, 2019.
ITB Chancellor Kadarsah Suryadi said that the Tangguh Disaster Campus model is targeted to be completed next year or 2020. "If it's done, it can be duplicated by other campuses or schools," he said.
The design will involve cross-disciplines at ITB which has 110 groups of expertise. ITB will create a special institution to handle disaster resilience. ITB campuses are spread across Bandung, Jatinangor-Sumedang, and Cirebon.
In addition, BNPB invites ITB to conduct research and cooperation with a number of institutions from abroad. "If a disaster occurs, the team from ITB together with the quick reaction team from BNPB are in the field to conduct research studies," Doni said. The goal is to get a complete picture of the disaster that occurred.
Doni gave an example of the earthquake in Maluku. "Since September 26, up to today, the aftershocks have almost reached 2,000 times," he said.
Hundreds of earthquake among them felt by residents. BNPB supports its research by installing seismographs at 11 points such as Ambon, Haruku and Saparua. "So that we can get a complete picture of the very aggressive earthquake in Maluku."
BNPB Deputy for Systems and Strategy Wisnu Widjaja said the Disaster Resilient Campus program had never been discussed with the relevant ministers. Prior to ITB, a similar concept had been created by Gadjah Mada University and a private campus in Bali. "The plan will be discussed in a meeting with the Minister of Education and Culture," he said.
ANWAR SISWADI
